image.altText: The sign at the tip says "transfer station".

props.synopsis: ACT police say the man was hit by the truck and knocked into the rubbish collection area, suffering fatal injuries.

title.children: Man dies after being hit by reversing truck at Canberra tip

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a dark blue suit and glasses walks outside a court building looking serious.

props.synopsis: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has been suspended without pay from his role as CEO of the Cultural Facilities Corporation while he faces charges for grooming a teenager.

title.children: Former ACT politician suspended from role amid grooming charges

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The former military lawyer was sentenced to five years and eight months in jail after sharing classified material with journalists in a case that has raised debate about whistleblower laws.

title.children: David McBride loses last-ditch effort to overturn conviction

image.altText: David Pocock playing parliamentary sport.

props.synopsis: The former star Wallabies player turned independent senator was kicked out of the social sports club after raising concerns about its links to the gambling industry.

title.children: Pocock reinvited to parliamentary sports club after PM weighs in

image.altText: A man looks to the ground as leaves a Canberra court.

props.synopsis: A 38-year-old man has been spared jail time, partly on account of his autism diagnosis, after raping a woman he met online and filming their sexual encounters without consent.

title.children: Man spared jail time by ACT court after raping woman he met online

image.altText: Ravi bends his knees to lift the weight, standing in the gym.

props.synopsis: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

title.children: 82yo man headed to world powerlifting championships

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

title.children: High Court endorses use of encrypted phone app to monitor crime figures

image.altText: Two pedestrians walking northbound across a three-lane road bridge with a pedestrian path over a lake.

props.synopsis: Loneliness is rising fastest among Canberrans in their 30s and 40s, with new research showing this cohort is now more likely than younger people to report feeling lonely in the ACT.

title.children: Canberrans in their 30s and 40s now the city's loneliest, survey finds

image.altText: A close up of a woman with dark straight hair.

props.synopsis: Toxic algae is sometimes detected in Canberra's waterways, where a dog died after swimming.

title.children: 'It was so fast': Dog owners warned poor water quality can kill in minutes

image.altText: Donna Nelson eating an icecream, wearing a crochet top.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother duped into becoming a drug mule in an elaborate love scam abandons her final line of appeal on drug importing charges in Japan.

title.children: Grandmother duped into becoming drug mule aborts fight against Japan sentence

image.altText: Two Filipino women walking past a damaged, swaying white building and concrete rubble, and a yellow crime tape

props.synopsis: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

title.children: Two dead after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says the federal government's First Home Guarantee scheme could see some Australians taking out riskier loans.

title.children: RBA governor says First Home Guarantee could lead to riskier loans

image.altText: A man in a cream suit walks down a footpath with another woman

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's husband David Sharaz is served bankruptcy papers by former Senator Linda Reynolds, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her by a Perth court for defamation.

title.children: David Sharaz served bankruptcy papers by Linda Reynolds

image.altText: Devonport collapsed tree

props.synopsis: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, amid severe winds and wet weather, police say.

title.children: Two dead after tree falls in Tasmanian wild weather

image.altText: CCTV video of man about to attack blonde woman on street.

props.synopsis: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.

title.children: In the world's 'phone theft capital', one Aussie decides to fight back

image.altText: A female in a doctor's uniform stands with a stethoscope around her neck.

props.synopsis: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded — despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

title.children: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5bn bulk billing boost for four years

image.altText: Three activists pumping fists

props.synopsis: Australians who were on the Global Sumud Flotilla, a fleet of ships intercepted by Israel's navy off Gaza last week, are met by supporters upon their arrival.

title.children: Freed flotilla activists greeted by crowd at Australian airport

image.altText: Family of ducks cross busy freeway causing six-car crash

props.synopsis: Six cars are caught in a pile-up as a family of ducks attempts to cross busy Kwinana Freeway during the morning peak hour in Perth.

title.children: Family of ducks crossing Perth freeway cause peak-hour pile up

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers charged with murder after the deaths of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek have refused to board the prison van to attend court.

title.children: Teens charged with murder after deaths of Melbourne boys refuse to attend court

image.altText: Charlie Curnow pumps his right fist during Carlton's AFL win over Essendon.

props.synopsis: The chase for Carlton star Charlie Curnow heated up on day five of the AFL trade period, with Geelong seeing an offer rejected as Sydney prepared its bid.

title.children: Blues secure two deals as Swans and Cats prepare for Curnow battle

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a provocative outfit of jewels with red lipstick and finger in mouth.

props.synopsis: The star's 12th album's sales success has come despite the mixed reception it received from critics and fans.

title.children: Swift breaks Adele's album sales record despite mixed reception

image.altText: Text messages are collaged over the protest on the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal internal discussions within the NSW government did not align with the external NSW Police messaging that the march could have been "catastrophic".

title.children: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Harbour Bridge Gaza march unfolded

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jim Chalmers QT

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

title.children: PM says 'nothing unusual' about Treasury meeting on super tax

image.altText: A middle-aged black woman stands behind a podium in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.

title.children: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud

image.altText: close up of russian soldiers shouting the national anthem

props.synopsis: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

title.children: Russia's 180,000 convict soldiers are causing concern for Putin

image.altText: A person holds up a phone showing the Google search web page.

props.synopsis: The launch of 'AI Mode' ushers in a future where news sites are kept alive to train AI chatbots for a US tech company.

title.children: A tiny new button in your search bar could kill the open web

image.altText: Pat Cummins looks to his left during a Test against India in 2024.

props.synopsis: With the opening men's Ashes Test six weeks away, Australia coach Andrew McDonald is not willing to rule out Pat Cummins taking the field in Perth.

title.children: Australia 'still optimistic' Cummins will play first Ashes Test

image.altText: boy looking away from the cameara with ABC hat on

props.synopsis: Hayden Eastbury lives with fragile X syndrome. He dreams of working for the ABC one day and has made it his mission to visit them all.

title.children: Meet Hayden Eastbury, the 17-year-old visiting every ABC bureau in Australia

image.altText: A plane crashed on the ground with emergency services surrounding it.

props.synopsis: The Russian president makes his first public admission of responsibility for the crash, in an effort to improve relations with Azerbaijan.

title.children: Putin says Russian air defences were to blame for Azerbaijani plane crash

image.altText: Two distressed women comfort each other.

props.synopsis: The World Health Organisation flags the risk of unregulated export of poisoned Indian cough syrup after 19 deaths.

title.children: Death toll rises as industrial solvent found in more Indian cough syrups

image.altText: An Indigenous musician

props.synopsis: Yolngu musician Baker Boy talks to News Breakfast about channelling difficult emotions after the Voice referendum to create his new album.

title.children: From the ARIAs to the AFL we can’t stop watching Baker Boy ‘sonically evolve’

image.altText: Four khaki military trucks with red stars carry large missiles.

props.synopsis: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

title.children: Is the US military build-up on these islands inviting China's missiles?

image.altText: Tony Popovic laughs at a 2025 Socceroos training session.

props.synopsis: In the build-up to Saturday's match in Montreal, Socceroos coach Tony Popovic feels Canada has given his squad the ultimate compliment.

title.children: Why Socceroos are happy to be labelled 'stingy' ahead of Canada friendly

image.altText: Cheese is running through a paddock on three legs in the Elphinstone Dog Trials.

props.synopsis: Cheese was on track to be a champion when his working dog trial career was cut short by an accident. A year after recovering from surgery to amputate his front leg, the yellow border collie is back in the yards and the winner's circle.

title.children: 'No way I was putting him down': Three-legged muster dog mounts comeback

image.altText: A woman of asian appearance looking at mail while standing in front of letter boxes

props.synopsis: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone else’s bills and letters. Here’s what can you do about it.

title.children: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?
